body.name: WEBCAM (The Konrath Dark Thriller Collective Book 7)
body.description: The Dark Thriller Collective Thrills, Chills, & Suspense Galore Do you like your thrillers on the Dark Side? Do you like a few scares along with your suspense? Do you like books that make you turn on the light and check to see if the doors are locked? Do you like really morbid humor? Welcome to the Dark Thriller Collective... GRIPPING You'll grip the book so hard you'll break your own fingers...

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: From J.A. Konrath - FOUR THRILLING SERIES, ONE STORY WORLD Dark Thriller Collective Twelve edge-of-your-seat thriller novels featuring police officer Tom Mankowski, molecular biologist Dr. Frank Belgium, and ex-military Fabler as they face psychos, evil scientists, and worse... This series of complete--but connected--novels also ties in with the Jack Daniels Thrillers and the Codename Chandler series, taking readers into a rich, layered world where any character can pop up in anyone's book... and they do. Jack Daniels Suspense Twenty-two gripping suspense novels, and dozens of short stories, starring Chicago Homicide cop Jacqueline "Jack" Daniels, career criminal Phineas Troutt, private eye Harry McGlade, and too many serial killers to count... This series of complete--but connected--novels also ties in with the Konrath Dark Thriller Collective and the Codename Chandler series, pulling readers into a rich, layered world where any character can pop up in anyone's book... and they do. Codename Chandler Series Join secret agent Chandler, psychotic spy Hammett, and brilliant recluse Fleming as they fight to save the world--while also fighting each other--in eight jaw-dropping action tales... This series of complete--but connected--stories also ties in with the Konrath Dark Thriller Collective and the Jack Daniels Thrillers, taking readers into a rich, layered world where any character can pop up in anyone's book... and they do. Timecaster Trilogy Talon Avalon is a future cop who can forecast the past... and he's about to get in a buttload of trouble. This trilogy of complete--but connected--novels also ties in with the Konrath Dark Thriller Collective and the Jack Daniels Thrillers, pulling readers into a rich, layered world where any character can pop up in anyone's book... and they do.

This Is The Good Stuff You've Been Looking For WHAT MAKES GREAT HORROR Checklist For Readers Scary Can't Put It Down Give You Nightmares Great Villains Freaks You Out Heroes To Root For Emotional Impact Fantastic Ending Roller Coaster Strap in tight, because this is going to be one helluva ride... The Dark Thriller Collective Thrills, Chills, & Suspense Galore Do you like your thrillers on the Dark Side? Do you like a few scares along with your suspense? Do you like books that make you turn on the light and check to see if the doors are locked? Do you like really morbid humor? Welcome to the Dark Thriller Collective... GRIPPING You'll grip the book so hard you'll break your own fingers...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The three times of OCD
reviews.reviewText: I have to admit..I'm quite a fan of yours..or rather, steadily becoming as such. Your work is done well and keeps me enthralled and wanting more.. You're are like an addiction, the more I have, is all the more I want.......Webcam is intriguing from the world of pure imagination of Greek mythology and the pundit angle..I liked that.I enjoy the world of your characters that move in different places and times. Well written and easy to understand, follow...watch out for the hidden twists throughout..you never shall know, where the Konrath thrillers will go...thanx for sharing.......

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2016
reviews.reviewText: "Anything that links to the Internet can be compromised. Modern computer security isn't about keeping people out. It's about detecting them quickly once they get in."I'm fully aware that as I am writing this review, the tiny inconspicuous camera at the top of my laptop is staring right at me. The camera is always off. (At least I think it is.) With today's technology, any person anywhere in the world can turn on my webcam and enter my life, and I wouldn't even know it. It's a scary thought, and it just goes to show, it doesn't matter how careful you try to be on the internet, there are always ways around your protection. I will continue to be amazed and baffled by the amount of personal information people put online. Especially after reading this book.I have come to expect the macabre, twisted psychopaths that Kilborn dreams up. And The Snipper killer is defiantly up there with his most colourful creations. You're probably wondering why this maniac is called The Snipper. It's because this maniac has an affinity for eyelids. Or lack there of. With bodies stacked to the ceiling - or stuffed into barrels - and fear mounting in the city of Chicago, lovelorn homicide detective Tom Mankowski and his partner Roy are on the case. That is if their girlfriends aren't busy whinging about their long hours and moaning about the lack of alone time. Honestly, I was rooting for those two to be killed. Especially Joan, she had it coming.The killer is targeting webcam models. Specifically girls named Kendal. Not their screen names. Their real names. Again with the frightening Skynet style computer hacking, The Snipper worms his way into each girls life and gets knife-happy. The girls deserve Penance. They are sinners. And the only way to atone for their sins is through pain. Sorority girl Kendal Smith is next on The Snipper's list, but with her paranoid delusions and OCD counting habits, she doesn't know if she's in danger of a killer or of losing her mind.This is a thrill ride from start to finish. I can't tell you how much I've missed the gore-fest that is a Kilborn novel. And with an open (terrifying) ending, the door is open to more Snipper fun. Because there are so many more sinners in the world. All waiting for Penance.By the way, I have covered my webcam with masking tape so if any crazy killers have any ideas, find another hobby.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You won’t put this book down!!
reviews.reviewText: Wow!! What a read!! This book isn’t for the faint of heart, or those under 18, but man!! This was a GREAT book!! I couldn’t put it down!! Every page, every chapter leaves you hanging!! How will it end?!? Will they figure it out?!?The author did a great job Of using how easy it is to hack technology to spy and listen in on others into the story.I promise you will think twice about who is wat Hong and listening in while reading this book!!Overall, I can’t wait to read the next book!! Great job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Normally I can't put down any book written by Kilborn or Konrath but this book was amongst the few exceptions. While it had a decent storyline and characters I found the usual edge of your seat feeling I so enjoy normally from these books just wasn't there. It was a decent read but not one I'd ear mark to read again if I wanted an excellent thrill worth revisiting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I think Mr Konrath is insane. What kinda mind does it take to think up this stuff? Really, it's a great story. A lot of action, suspense and thrills. Great ending to a great book. If you are into thrills and suspense then this book is for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars edge of my seat
reviews.reviewText: Ahhh couldn’t stop reading until i fell Asleep. Had to find out what happened next.I would read this if i were you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WEBCAM IS AN AWESOME READ!!!
reviews.reviewText: WEBCAM might be a book that the average reader might read with the lights on...lol. Probably sleep with lights on for months after reading...lol Horror at its best!! The creepiest killer EVER!!Webcams are everywhere in this story! Not one character realizes just how creepy it would be, if some crazy person was watching them, night and day.... That is, until it's too late!!!A MUST READ....With the lights on, if necessary...LOL.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars There’s something wrong with this author.....and I can’t put his books down.
reviews.reviewText: What an incredible mind. First intermingling this story with a Jack Daniels novel I’d previously read. Next, the ability to make me cringe one moment and laugh out loud with the next sentence. This author is a genius storyteller who has some of the most disgusting thoughts I’ve ever read. Holy moly - can’t wait to see what he comes up with next.

I really enjoyed this book. I love J. A. Konrath's stoty telling skills. I've read the Jack Daniels series and it was fantastic and this book almost feels like an extension. So worth the read. Great book

I wonder how authors imagine the unimaginable. This novel is a testimony to the creative visualiztion of the author. Story is interesting with good dosage of twists and turns.Recommend this novel only to those who can withstand fearful stuff.

Nach einem etwas langsameren Einstieg entwickelt sich das Buch wieder zu einem absoluten Page-Turner. Das Ende ist etwas abrupt und das verweben verschiedener Bücher und Handlungen gewöhnungsbedürftig. Dennoch, die Handlung macht süchtig und der Spannungsbogen wie immer absolut mitreissend. Kurzweilige, spannende Unterhaltung!

If you've read Kilborn's other works namely "The List", then you'll be familiar with the main protagonist here. Tom Mankowski is back and investigating the mysterious deaths of webcam models, ones particularly named Kendall. Each victim is tortured and mutilated and it's up to our favorite detective to solve the case.The book is full for suspense and mystery. It had me guessing who the real killer is and I love the plot twist in the end. Each page is a turner, and the more they get closer to solve the mystery, the more they get setbacks. I also liked it how the author gave insight in Tom's relationship with his partner and how they try to keep their relationship going despite the challenges they face due to Tom's job. Full of sick and twisted imagery, this book is a must for Kilborn fans.I gave it a four star because while it's creepy and scary, it didn't get me at the same level as his other books. I also highly recommend "Afraid" and "Endurance" to read to experience the horror this author can write.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 22, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: Detective Tom Mankowski is on the trail but will he catch Erinyes before one of his loved ones is added to that scoresheet
reviews.reviewText: Someone is stalking and killing webcam models, but their online activities are not the only thing they have in common. The killer is targeting women named Kendal, and anyone else who gets in the way is fair game too. The body count rises. Detective Tom Mankowski is on the trail but will he catch Erinyes before one of his loved ones is added to that scoresheet? There is a brief tie-in with Joe Konrath's (aka Jack Kilborn) recent novel Rum Runner and with Ann Voss Peterson's recent novella Watched Too Long, but knowing their stories is not necessary to enjoy WEBCAM.
